etymology.description: 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") + 發(發) (fā, "emit") = hand action represented by a related sound -> to push aside
etymology.interpretation: The character 撥(bō, "to push aside") combines 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") as a semantic element suggesting an action performed by hand with 發(發) (fā, "emit") to indicate the pronunciation. Together, they evoke the idea of using the hand to move something aside.
etymology.simplification: 撥(撥) (bō, "to push aside") was simplified to 拨(撥) by retaining the hand radical 扌 (an abbreviated form of 手(手) (shǒu, "hand")) while preserving overall meaning.

examples.chinese: 他撥開桌上的雜物(他撥開桌上的雜物)，露出光滑的桌面(露出光滑的桌面)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bō kāi zhuō shàng de záwù, lù chū guānghuá de zhuōmiàn.
examples.english: He pushed aside the clutter on the table, revealing the smooth tabletop.

examples.chinese: 請撥開那塊大布(請撥開那塊大布)，看看下面隱藏的秘密(看看下面隱藏的秘密)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bō kāi nà kuài dà bù, kàn kàn xiàmiàn yǐncáng de mìmì.
examples.english: Please push aside that large cloth to see the hidden secret underneath.
